title: Data management system

Overview

Connection details


Which data to fetch


How program should behave

title: Data management system
text:
Provide Survey Solutions connection details

server      <- "" # provide the complete URL of the server
workspace   <- "" # use the name that is an ID rather than the display name
user        <- "" # note: user must be either admin or API user
password    <- "" # password of the user indicated above

title: Data management system
section: Identify questionnaires whose data to fetch
text:
Identify questionnaires whose data to fetch

# provide a string that uniquely identifies the questionnaire. this can be:
# - full name
# - sub-string
# - regular expression

# recall data
qnr_expr_hbs <- ""

# diary record book data
qnr_expr_drb <- ""

title: Data management system
text:
Example expressions










Full nameSubstringRegex



"ZiHBS 2023 Actual Pilot" -> "ZiHBS 2023 Actual Pilot"
"ZiHBS 2023 V4" -> "ZiHBS 2023 V4", "ZiHBS 2023 V4" 




"Pilot" -> "ZiHBS 2023 Pilot training V1", "ZiHBS 2023 Actual Pilot"
"ZiHBS" -> everything 



"V[0-9]{1}" -> "ZiHBS 2023 Pilot training V1", "ZiHBS 2023 V4", "ZiHBS 2023 V4"

title: Data management system
section: Describe how check issues program should behave
text:
Describe how check issues program should behave
The program allows users to specify three types of behavior

Which interview statuses to consider
Which issues trigger rejection
Whether to reject interviews automatically

title: Data management system
text:
Which interview statuses to consider



# Provide a comma-separated list of interview statuses to review.
# See status values here: 
# https://docs.mysurvey.solutions/headquarters/export/system-generated-export-file-anatomy/#coding_status
#
# Statuses supported by this script include: 
# - Completed: 100
# - ApprovedBySupervisor: 120
# - ApprovedByHeadquarters: 130
statuses_to_reject <- c(100, 120)



Act as HQ (i.e., handle supervisor-approved interviews only): statuses_to_reject <- c(100, 120)
Act simultaneously as HQ and all supervisors: statuses_to_reject <- c(100, 120)
Double-check decisions made by human HQ users: statuses_to_reject <- c(130)

title: Data management system
text:
Which issues trigger rejection

# Provide a comma-separated list of issue types to reject
# {susoreview} uses the following codes:
# - 1 = Reject
# - 2 = Comment to post
# - 3 = Survey Solutions validation error
# - 4 = Review
issues_to_reject <- c(1)

title: Data management system
text:
Whether to reject interviews automatically

# Whether to reject interviews recommended for rejection
# - If TRUE, the program will instruct the server to reject these interviews.
# - If FALSE, the program will not.
# - In either case, the interviews recommended for rejection, 
# and the reasons why, are saved in `/output/`
should_reject <- FALSE

title: Data management system
section: Describe how check issues program should behave
text:
Describe how check issues program should behave
The program allows users to specify three types of behavior

Which interview statuses to consider
Which issues trigger rejection
Whether to reject interviews automatically

title: Data management system
text:
Which interview statuses to consider



# Provide a comma-separated list of interview statuses to review.
# See status values here: 
# https://docs.mysurvey.solutions/headquarters/export/system-generated-export-file-anatomy/#coding_status
#
# Statuses supported by this script include: 
# - Completed: 100
# - ApprovedBySupervisor: 120
# - ApprovedByHeadquarters: 130
statuses_to_reject <- c(100, 120)



Act as HQ (i.e., handle supervisor-approved interviews only): statuses_to_reject <- c(100, 120)
Act simultaneously as HQ and all supervisors: statuses_to_reject <- c(100, 120)
Double-check decisions made by human HQ users: statuses_to_reject <- c(130)

title: Data management system
text:
Which issues trigger rejection

# Provide a comma-separated list of issue types to reject
# {susoreview} uses the following codes:
# - 1 = Reject
# - 2 = Comment to post
# - 3 = Survey Solutions validation error
# - 4 = Review
issues_to_reject <- c(1)

title: Data management system
text:
Whether to reject interviews automatically

# Whether to reject interviews recommended for rejection
# - If TRUE, the program will instruct the server to reject these interviews.
# - If FALSE, the program will not.
# - In either case, the interviews recommended for rejection, 
# and the reasons why, are saved in `/output/`
should_reject <- FALSE

title: Data management system
text:
Data management system’s scope

Acquisition


Reporting


Processing

title: Data management system
text:
Data management system’s status

Acquisition 📦


Reporting 🚧


Processing 📦

title: Data management system
text:
Process



Downloads 


For target questionnaire(s):

obtains data for every version (e.g., v1, v2, …, vN)
unpacks the zip file

title: Data management system
text:
Process



Downloads 


Combines 


For each questionnaire, combines data from multiple versions into a single set of data files containing all observations.

title: Data management system
text:
Process



Downloads 


Combines 


Constructs 


For certain questionnaires, creates data files in more convenient form than exported (e.g., a single file for food consumption rather than one for each food group).

title: Data management system
text:
Covers

HBS 


Diary

title: Data management system
text:
Reports



Inventories 




Video


Inventories the data received by primary sampling unit, flagging cases with data shortfalls

title: Data management system
text:
Reports



Inventories 


Monitors 







Monitors trends in survey microdata that could undercut key survey indicators

title: Data management system
text:
Reports



Inventories 


Monitors 


Analyses 



Analyses trends in survey paradata that could indicate problems (e.g., short interviews, answer changes, etc.). See example here

title: Data management system
text:
Processing



Checks 


Checks for issues in incoming interview data.

title: Data management system
text:
Processing



Checks 


Recommends 


Recommends what to do with each interview: approve, review, reject, discuss with field staff due to persisent problems.

title: Data management system
text:
Processing



Checks 


Recommends 


Executes 


Executes the process for rejection, if desired. This entails:

Construct rejection message, composed of all issue detected
Post question-level comments
Reject the interview

title: Data management system
text:
Processing



Checks 


Recommends 


Executes 


Reports 


Reports on identified issues in two ways. First, by creating files the flagged issues. Second, by generating a report of the top issues, the top reasons for rejection, and the number of rejections.
